name: Codec
comment:
A restlib_core/net.Codec encodes and (if supported) decodes data.

Codecs can be fused. For example fusing restlib_core/dart-convert.JSON and restlib_core/dart-convert.UTF8 produces an encoder that can convert Json objects directly to bytes, or can decode bytes directly to json objects.

Fused codecs generally attempt to optimize the operations and can be faster than executing each step of an encoding separately.

Codecs are still experimental and are subject to change without notice.

encoder.name: encoder
encoder.comment:
Returns the encoder from restlib_core/dart-convert.Codec.S to restlib_core/dart-convert.Codec.T.

It may be stateful and should not be reused.

decoder.name: decoder
decoder.comment:
Returns the decoder of this, converting from restlib_core/dart-convert.Codec.T to restlib_core/dart-convert.Codec.S.

It may be stateful an should not be reused.

inverted.name: inverted
inverted.comment:
Inverts this.

The restlib_core/net.Codec.encoder and restlib_core/net.Codec.decoder of the resulting codec are swapped.

fuse.name: fuse
fuse.comment:
Fuses this with other.

When encoding, the resulting codec encodes with this before encoding with restlib_core/net.Codec.fuse.other.

When decoding, the resulting codec decodes with restlib_core/net.Codec.fuse.other before decoding with this.

In some cases one needs to use the restlib_core/net.Codec.inverted codecs to be able to fuse them correctly. That is, the output type of this (restlib_core/dart-convert.Codec.T) must match the input type of the second codec restlib_core/net.Codec.fuse.other.

Examples:

final JSON_TO_BYTES = JSON.fuse(UTF8);
List<int> bytes = JSON_TO_BYTES.encode(["json-object"]);
var decoded = JSON_TO_BYTES.decode(bytes);
assert(decoded is List && decoded[0] == "json-object");

var inverted = JSON.inverted;
var jsonIdentity = JSON.fuse(inverted);
var jsonObject = jsonIdentity.encode(["1", 2]);
assert(jsonObject is List && jsonObject[0] == "1" && jsonObject[1] == 2);

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides restlib_core/net.Codec.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and restlib_core/net.Codec.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the restlib_core/net.Codec.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
restlib_core/net.Codec.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to restlib_core/net.Codec.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If restlib_core/net.Codec.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of restlib_core/net.Codec.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
